alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 9:28AM CDT until May 24 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Los Fresnos, Rancho Viejo, Cameron Park, Olmito, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Driscoll Childrens Hospital, Valley Regional Medical Center, Brownsville Sports Park, Vela Middle School, Pullam Elementary School, Brownsville Golf Center, Rancho Verde Elementary School, Brownsville Event Center, Sunrise Mall, Stillman Middle School, Northside Transfer Station and Gallegos Elementary School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
